I’m currently a postdoctoral research fellow at the<a href='https://www.lse.ac.uk/government/people/research-staff/zachary-dickson'> London School of Economics</a> on the<a href='https://sites.google.com/view/covideuproject/home'> COVIDEU project</a>. I'm also an affiliate at the <a href='https://www.lse.ac.uk/DSI'> LSE Data Science Institute</a>.
 My research focuses on elites, representation and computational methods. You can find out more about some of my current research projects <a href='https://z-dickson.github.io/research.html'>here</a>.   
<br>
Prior to my PhD at the University of Glasgow, I earned a masters in international relations at the University of Edinburgh and a bachelor’s degree in political science at Northeastern Illinois University in my hometown of Chicago.

A copy of my CV (which probably needs to be updated) can be downloaded [here](assets/dickson_CV.pdf)</a>.
